intro: Tephrosia aldabrensis, commonly known as Aldabra tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to the Aldabra Atoll in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, coastal environments and is adapted to withstand saline conditions. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and can remain viable in the soil for extended periods. Tephrosia aldabrensis plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and supporting local biodiversity.
